Write-Up Text: A group of people with diverse backgrounds including charity organizations politicians academics business leaders and community advocates have called on the Australian Prime Minister to increase JobSeeker and related payments in the May Budget. The same group urged the Prime Minister to avoid policies that would trigger a supply collapse closure of local pharmacies or reduction in operating hours. There is also a debate around the defense budget which some people say is outsourcing Australia's defense and security policy to foreign agents. Additionally Women in Economics aims to ensure women economists' voices are heard in policy debates. Finally the federal government and NRMA have confirmed their deal to invest in charging infrastructure across 131 potential regional locations.
